datafield.subfield: [edited by] Gregory A. Mencio, Marc F. Swiontkowski.
Preceded by Skeletal trauma in children / [edited by] Neil E. Green, Marc F. Swiontkowski. 4th ed. c2009.

Skeletal growth, development, and healing as related to pediatric trauma / Steven L. Frick -- Physeal injuries / Alexandre Arkader and David L. Skaggs -- Casting techniques / Steven Lovejoy and Jonathan Schoenecker -- Pathologic fractures in children / Herbert S. Schwartz and Ginger E. Holt -- The multiply injured child / George H. Thompson, Lorraine C. Stern, John H. Wilber and Jochen P. Son-Hing -- Fractures with soft tissue injuries / Sanjeev Sabharwal -- Complications of fractures in children / Anthony Stans -- Outcomes assessment of fractures in children / Unni G. Narayanan -- Fractures and dislocations of the forearm, wrist, and hand / Peter M. Waters and Chris Stutz -- Fractures and dislocations about the elbow / Gregory A. Mencio -- Fractures and dislocations about the shoulder / James F. Mooney III and Lawrence X. Webb -- Fractures of the spine / Jeff Martus and Gregory A. Mencio -- Fractures and dislocations about the hip and pelvis / Marc F. Swiontkowski and Mengnai Li -- Fractures of the femoral shaft / Jeffrey Shilt and Ying Li -- Fractures around the knee in children / Lewis E. Zionts, Mauricio Silva, and Seth Gamradt -- Fractures of the tibia and fibula / George H. Thompson, Anna Wallace, and Jochen P. Son-Hing -- Fractures and dislocations of the foot and ankle / Alvin H. Crawford, Charles T. Mehlman, and Shital Parikh -- Non-accidental trauma / Jeffrey Shilt and Paul McPherson -- Anesthesia and analgesia for the ambulatory management of children's fractures / Sheila McMorrow Jones and Andrea C. Bracikowski -- Rehabilitation of the child with multiple injuries / Louise Z. Spierre, Christine Thorogood, and Charles T. Mehlman -- Skeletal trauma in young athletes / Kevin Shea, Eric W. Edmonds, Henry Chambers, and John C. Jacobs Jr. -- Nerve injury and repair in children / Scott H. Kozin and Dan A. Zlotolow.
Access restricted to authorized users and institutions.

Obtain the best outcomes from the latest techniques with help from a "who's who" of pediatric orthopaedic trauma experts! Considered as the "go-to" reference for orthopaedic trauma surgeons and pediatric orthopaedic trauma surgeons, Green's Skeletal Trauma in Children presents practical, focused guidance on managing traumatic musculoskeletal injuries in children and adolescents. It emphasizes the unique aspects of children's fractures in terms of epidemiology, mechanisms, management, and the challenges of treating the skeletally immature patient. State-of-the-art coverage includes crucial chapters on skeletal trauma related to child abuse, anesthesia and analgesia, management of children's fractures, and outcome measures and rehabilitation.
Description based on print version record.
